com.alexforan.please

Class HTTPResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.alexforan.please.HTTPResponse

  • public class HTTPResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    Object symbolizing an HTTP response.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected HTTPResponse(org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse response, org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient client)
      Should not be called directly.

    • Method Summary

      void close()
      Closes the response.

      Print the status, reason, and headers to System.out.

      Print the status, reason, and headers.

      Retrieve the body as an @{link java.io.InputStream}.

      Retrieve the body as an byte[].

      Retrieves the content-type of the response body (mime), or null if that header isn't set.

        Should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        response - The response that this wraps.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the response. Should be called if there is a body whose contents are being streamed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • finalize

        protected final void finalize()
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

        java.lang.Throwable

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus()
        Retrieve the status code of the response.

      • getStatusText

        public java.lang.String getStatusText()
        Retrieve the textual status (reason) for the response.

      • isOk

        public boolean isOk()
        Convenience helper that checks if the response is within the 200 (acceptable) range.

      • getContentType

        public java.lang.String getContentType()
        Retrieves the content-type of the response body (mime), or null if that header isn't set.

      • hasBody

        public boolean hasBody()
        Convenience helper that checks if the response has a body.

      • getBody

        public java.io.InputStream getBody()
                            throws HTTPResponseException
        Retrieve the body as an @{link java.io.InputStream}. The user is then responsible for closing the stream when finished.
        Throws:
        HTTPResponseException - If there's a general I/O error.

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
                throws HTTPResponseException
        Retrieve the body as an byte[]. The stream will be closed automatically. This method will not be spectacularly performant - if you're willing to add a third-party dependency, look at commons-io's IOUtils.toByteArray(InputStream).
        Throws:
        HTTPResponseException - If there's a general I/O error.

      • getBodyText

        public java.lang.String getBodyText()
                             throws HTTPResponseException
        Convenience method to return the body as a string.
        Throws:
        HTTPResponseException

      • getJSON

        public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode getJSON()
                                                throws HTTPResponseException
        Retrieve the JSON body as a @{link org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode}.
        Throws:
        HTTPResponseException - If there's an error reading or parsing the body.

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieve the value of a header in the response if it's set, or null if it's not. If there's more than one header with that name, the first will be returned.

      • getHeaders

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getHeaders()
        Retrieve all headers in the response.

      • dump

        public HTTPResponse dump()
        Print the status, reason, and headers to System.out. Useful for debugging.
        Returns:
        this

      • dump

        public HTTPResponse dump(java.io.PrintStream out)
        Print the status, reason, and headers. Useful for debugging.
        Returns:
        this
